SPML.title: Statistics and Programming
updateFrequency: New content is added to this course daily
SPML.summary:
This beginner-friendly course teaches the core theoretical and practical concepts in statistical inference and, by extension, machine learning. Statistics and ML have broad applications in the real world but many struggle to learn statistics and ML because they don't have a strong foundation in mathematics and programming. 

This course teaches the foundations of mathematics and programming, and enable you to actually understand statistics and machine learning.
SPML.description: Learn the science and mathematics of inference. Includes examples in machine learning and applications from healthcare to finance to engineering. Perform statistical analysis with Python and understand the foundations of bayesian statistical learning.
SPML.descriptionLong:
This courses teaches Statistics and Probability Theory with emphasis on learning from first principles. To learn advanced Statistics and, in particular, Probability Theory, it is necessary to be familiar with other mathematical topics including Integration, Sequences, Series, Sets, and Combinatrics. Although this course has Statistics and Probability Theory in the title, it contains sufficient supplementary material about other mathematical subjects that is necessary for mastery in Statistics and Probability Theory.

This course also teaches R, the programming language for statistical analysis. You will learn the required programming constructs to perform analysis in this specialized programming language. You will learn to apply the appropriate functions and methods, import and process data, produce meaningful visualizations, and interpret the results of analysis (e.g, Correlation, ANOVA, etc.)

rootDocs.title: Google Meet for Live Office Hours

weeks.weekTitle: Module 1 - Overview of Statistics and Machine Learning
weeks.description: n module 1, we will look at how statistical and probabilistic techniques are used in different domains – from healthcare to finance to engineering and other disciplines. We will also look at how machine learning evolved from the science and mathematics of statistics.

weeks.weekTitle: Module 2 - Programming and Scripting: Python and BASH
weeks.description: The true power of statisitcs is realized when we implement descriptive and inferential techniques using computation. In this module, we will learn the programming language, Python, and the scripting languge, BASH. Python is the programming language in machine learning and also widely used in statistics. BASH will be used to manage files and install libraries for our work.

In this module we will introduce two important inferential techniques in classical (or frequentist) statistics: regression analysis and hypothesis testing. We will also look at the concept of likelihood, and, from there, build upon our understanding and work towards the alternative inferential methods of bayesian statistics.

The most central branch of mathematics in statisitcs is probability theory. There are two interpretations of probability theory: frequentist and bayesian. As a result of these different ways of understanding probability, the science of statistics has diverged into two different ways of infering from data. We will see these two interpretations differ and when they are relevant.

Machine Learning has evolved from statistical modeling and algorithmic modeling of computer science. More important, machine learning made it possible to perform statistical and probabilistic inferential techniques on large volumes of data. In this module, we will learn further develop our programming skills by applying them to applications in machine learning.

The Bayesian Theorem (and the algebraic adaptations of it) are at the center of the most powerful machine learning and deep learning models. In this module, we will delve deeper into bayesian methods, discuss the importance of prior and posterior distributions, and understand why bayesian inference is so important in machine learning.

weeks.weekTitle: Module 7 – Calculus and Algebra for Statistics
weeks.description: Statistics is a mathematical science with probability theory at its core. However, probability theory can be properly studies if the mathematical prerequisites are learnt. The prerequisites for probability theory include, among other branches of mathematics, calculus, combinatorics, classical algebra, and basic abstract algebra. We will cover these prerequisites both in live lectures and supplementary learning material.

weeks.weekTitle: Module 8 – Probability Distributions and Machine Learning
weeks.description: In this final learning module, we will study the probability distributions, their applications, and their derivations. It is very important for any statistician, data scientist, or anyone who professionally uses statistics to understand how and why probability functions are expressed the way they are. This module will cover important probability distributions such as binomial distribution, Poission distribution, and the normal distribution.

This module is dedicated to your capstone project, the completion of which is required to earn the certificate for 'Professional Certificate in Statistics and Programing'. Completing this project will involve modeling data, data transformations with Python, visualization, inference and error measurements.

highlights: Beginner-friendly course. Includes advanced content for intermediate learners.
Covers the mathematics and statistics of machine learning.
Intuitive explanations of mathematical and statistical theory
Step-by-step breakdown of complex technical concepts.
Learn through programming, exercises, and practical real-world applications.
First-principles teaching style. Learn from elementary to advanced concepts.
SPML.event: Attend the Course Q&A on TBD to learn more about this program.

CSApp.title: Computer Science and Applications
CSApp.summary:
This beginner-friendly course teaches programming and computer science through application development with JavaScript and the NodeJS ecosystem. You will learn how to develop the different components of a complete application (fullstack) and, in the process, the importance of various topics of computer science such data structures, computer networks, and computer organization. Additionally, you learn to deploy your app to the Google Cloud Platform.

 You will have the option to specialize your certificate in areas such Fullstack Development, CS Theory, Cybersecurity, Data Analysis, or general Computer Science.
CSApp.description: Learn computer science and programming with modern application development. Choose to specialize in an area such as CS theory, fullstack devleopment, data analysis, or cybersecurity.
highlights: Beginner-friendly course. Includes advanced content for intermediate learners.
Covers the applications and theory of computer science.
Intuitive explanations of programming and theoretical topics
Step-by-step breakdown of complex technical concepts.
Learn through programming, exercises, and practical real-world applications.
First-principles teaching style. Learn from elementary to advanced concepts.
updateFrequency: New content is added to this course weekly

weeks.description: The first module of the course will introduce to main programming constructs in found in almost all programming languages such as variables, control statements, functions, and basic data structures. JavaScript is both a general purpose programming language and loosely typed, which means many applications can be built with it and it is reletively easy to learn.

The most important skill for any programmer is the understanding of and implementation of data structures. Mastering data structures requires the understanding of how computers organize and process data. The better your understanding of data structures, the better your problem solving abilities.

In this module, you will learn the fundamentals of creating a user interface (UI) and to control the behaviour of the UI element with event binding and listening. You will learn to organize a UI with the HTML markup language and control elements with JavaScript. Design systems and styling (via CSS) will be covered as independent learning.

HyperText Transfer Protocol is the set of methods by which data is exchanged between computers in the Internet. To understand HTTP is to understand how computers exchange data, and this level of understanding is key for building applications — in particular backend applications. You will learn to develop and work with APIs, the OSI layer, and connect your UI and backend apps together via HTTP.

This module will cover the different types of database systems and their use cases. Additionally, you will learn to use and host data on the MongoDB database service, which is a popular graph-based (or NoSQL) database management system used in a wide variety of applications. You will learn how to configure a MongoDB cluster, connect to it from an application, and perform CRUD operations via Mongo shell and the Mongoose library.

In this module, we combine what we learn about computer networks and databases to build a prototye application for interfacing between the UI and the database. We will learn to use the Git CLI (command line interface) for both version control and its role in DevOps (developer operations).  We will in more detail look at API development using OpenAPI and

GCS, or Google Cloud Computing, is a service from Google for running applications and storing data in Google data centers. Cloud computing, generally speaking, is the about using clusters of specialized computers for running process that are intensive with respect to processing, storage, memory, or networking (or all of these). You will learn general concepts in cloud computing and how to deploy your app and store data on GCS.
In this module, you can choose a specialization for your professional certification. You can choose from one of the following topics to specialize in:

extra.title: Computer Science
extra.description: This covers computer science more broadly wit special focus on computer organization, computer architecture, and low level programming. In particular, C++ will be covered as this is both a low-level and high-level programming language, which helps us to appreciate how computers work from the application level all the way down to the hardware level.

extra.title: CS Theory
extra.description: This specialization focus on discrete mathematics, the most important branch of mathematics in computer science. Discrete mathematics will provide us with the tools to analyze the performance, theoretically, of algorithms. Moreover, will look at more advanced graph data structures – the understanding of which requires a good foundation in discrete mathenatics.

extra.title: Cybersecurity
extra.description: This specialization is centered on cryptography, the mathematics of it, and the algorithms that allow for data to be securely transmitted and stored. Additionally, we will cover aspects of vulnerabilities with respect to digital exchange of data, and what methods are used to address these vulnerabilities.

extra.title: Fullstack Development
extra.description: This specialization teaches ReactJS and NextJS. The former is library for UI state management and the latter is a library (and framework) for building React-based fullstack applications. You will learn about React concepts, such as states, props, hooks, contexts, and conditional rendering. You will also learn the ins-and-outs of NextJS for provision a backend app for your fullstack app. Unit-testing will be covered as independent learning.

extra.title: Data Analysis
extra.description: A new discipline that relies greatly on the power of computers and computer programming is data science.           This specialization covers the aspects of comptuer scienec relevant to data science such as Python, data preprocessing, APIs, BASH scripting, the NumPy library, and descriptive statistics – which provides a good foundation for the more advanced inferential statistics.

NumPy.title: NumPy with Applications - Dubai
NumPy.summary:
NumPy is a library for performing matrix operations in the Python programming language. This library is used both directly and indirectly (in other libraries) for all kinds of computational applications such as image processing, statistics, machine learning, and numerical methods.

 To make the best use of NumPy, you need to be competent in both (1) programming and (2) linear algebra. Linear algebra is the algebra of special types of sets called vectors, and the general cases of which include matrices and tensors. 

In this course, you will be given an overview of the NumPy library, Linear Algebra, and example applications in image processing. You will learn enough of the fundamentals to more quickly advance your understanding of NumPy and the libraries that are built on top of NumPy such Pandas, TensorFlow, and PyTensor.
NumPy.description: Deep dive into NumPy and learn the fundamentals of matrix operations. Learn to apply various NumPy methods with applications in image processing.
NumPy.pricing: For certification option: AED 650 (inclusive of VAT)
highlights: Beginner-friendly course. Includes advanced content for intermediate learners.
Covers some applications and theory of linear algebra.
Intuitive explanations of programming and theoretical topics
Step-by-step breakdown of complex technical concepts.
Learn through programming, exercises, and practical real-world applications.
First-principles teaching style. Learn from elementary to advanced concepts.
updateFrequency: New content is added to this course weekly

weeks.description: In day 1, you will be introduction to the main object of the NumPy library, nd.array, and its attributes and methods. You will learn how to process data with basic NumPy methods and how to access sections in multidimensional data. You will also apply what you learn to solve a practical data processing problem

In day 2, you will be introduced to fundamental concepts in linear algebra, including algebra axioms, gaussian elimination, matrix inversion, determinants, echelon form matrices, identity matrices, and others. You will apply what you learn about linear algebra to solve a system of equations.

In the final module, you will learn the basic of image processing and computer vision, with technqiues such as filters and convolutions. You will learn to use NumPy to preprocess and manipulate images as a practical exercise. Finally, you will be guided towards learning more advanced applications of NumPy and linear algebra

LMP.title: Linear Mathematics with Python
updateFrequency: New content is added to this course every two weeks
LMP.description: Learn the fundamentals and applications of linear algebra, matrix theory, and linear programming. In this course, you will learn about matrix operations, systems of equations, and optimization in the context of real-world applications and machine learning.

rootDocs.title: Google Meet for Live Office Hours

weeks.description: In the first week, we will create a motivating reason to learn about the applications of matrices and systems of equations. We will understand the development of linear algebra from a historical and practical perspective. The objective of this module is to develop a strong foundation for learning linear algebra and applications of it. Furthermore, this course is based in Python; therefore, we will thoroughly review the programming language and the famous library designed for multidimensional tabular data – NumPy.

weeks.weekTitle: Module 2 & 3 - Matrix Operations and Real-World Applications
weeks.description: In weeks 2 & 3, we will develop a more complete understanding of matrices, the algebra of matrices, and linear programming. In other words, Modules 2 and 3 are about mastering linear algebra and a closely related branch of mathematics called linear programming. Linear algebra is a very important branch of mathematics with very broad applications in the real world, and we will look at applications from economics to quantitative finance to logistics.

weeks.weekTitle: Module 4 -  Machine Learning and Neural Networks
weeks.description: In week 4, we will be introduced to machine learning and neural networks in the context of matrix representation of data. Neural Networks are the center of the most advanced use cases of machine learning such as computer vision and natural language processing. In this module we will look at examples of how matrices are used in machine learning.

LMP.event: Attend the Course Q&A on 27/Jun/2022 to learn more about this program.

children.title: Forecasting with Neural Networks and TensorFlow
Overview of Train, Validation, and Test
Neural Network Architecture for Image Classification
Overview of Hyperparamters in TensorFlow Playground
Example of Logistic Regression for Classification

SPR.title: Statistics, Probability Theory, and Programming
updateFrequency: New content is added to this course daily
SPR.description: Learn the mathematical science behind artificial intelligence, econometrics, risk engineering, and epidemiology. Learn to perform statistical analysis with the R and Python programming languages.
SPR.descriptionLong:
This courses teaches Statistics and Probability Theory with emphasis on learning from first principles. To learn advanced Statistics and, in particular, Probability Theory, it is necessary to be familiar with other mathematical topics including Integration, Sequences, Series, Sets, and Combinatrics. Although this course has Statistics and Probability Theory in the title, it contains sufficient supplementary material about other mathematical subjects that is necessary for mastery in Statistics and Probability Theory.

This course also teaches R, the programming language for statistical analysis. You will learn the required programming constructs to perform analysis in this specialized programming language. You will learn to apply the appropriate functions and methods, import and process data, produce meaningful visualizations, and interpret the results of analysis (e.g, Correlation, ANOVA, etc.)

rootDocs.title: Google Meet for Live Office Hours

weeks.weekTitle: Module 1 - Statistics and Probability Theory: Principles
weeks.description: In this week, we will begin by covering an important prerequisite, Mathematical Thinking, which will be about how math is used in Statistics and Probability Theory and the different notations that will be used. We will then go over some fundamental concepts in Statistics and Probability, which will help us to appreciate and quickly understand more advanced topics going forward.

In Module 2, we delve deeper into Probability Theory and other mathematical subjects which are involved in Statistics. We will look at the properties of Random Variables, Probability Distributions, and Moments. In particular, we"ll go over two important topics central to Probability Theory: Expected Values The Normal Distribution.

In Module 3, we will further cover concepts in Mathematical Statistics and study the relationship between multiple explanatory variables in more details. In particular, we will focus on Analysis of Variance (ANOVA). We will look at how Hypothesis Testing and Regression Analysis is performed and better understand tests for Statistical Signigicance.

The Bayesian Theorem (and the algebraic adaptations of it) are at the center of the most powerful machine learning and deep learning models. In this module, we will delve deeper into bayesian methods, discuss the importance of prior and posterior distributions, and understand why bayesian inference is so important in machine learning.

SPR.event: Attend the Course Q&A on TBD to learn more about this program.

children.title: Derivation of Bayes Theorem X
children.description: In this video, we'll look at the alebraic variations of the Bayes theorem and explain the terms that go into the formulae of the Bayes Theorem.

SQL.description: Learn the basics of SQL and relational databases in this course designed for beginners in data science, data engineering, and application development.
SQL.title: Introduction to SQL

weeks.description: In this module, you will learn the syntax of Structured Query Language and how to write procedures for CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.

MPD.description: Discover the fundamental concepts in mathematics through computer programming. Become proficient in both mathematics and programming. Gain key skills for mathematical sciences such as computer science, data science, and engineering.
MPD.descriptionLong:
This course covers programming in Python, the fundamentals Computer Science, and the fundamentals of Mathematics. In addition to learning to program in Python, you will understand, at the high level, how computers work and interpret programming languages. A high-level understanding of computer architecture will allow you to understand the most complex of algorithms and data structures. This course, which is the foundation couse for more advanced courses at BigNumber, is self-contained and focused on the first-principles of Computer Science and Pure Mathematics.

Pure Mathematics is about concepts in mathematics that are ubiquitous in all of Mathematics. In this course, you will learn the building blocks of mathematics that are relevant and necessary in all of the Mathematical and the Physical Sciences (e.g, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, and Economics).
MPD.title: Mathematics and Programming

rootDocs.title: Google Meet for Live Office Hours

weeks.weekTitle: Module 1 - Introduction to Programming and Computer Science
weeks.description: In the first week, we will learn the building blocks of a programming language and implementation of algorithms. We will learn to write algorithms in sequential, conditional, and iterative patterns. For data structures, we will go in depth about linear data structures, their methods, and algorithms for searching in and writing into data structures.
weeks.details:
Topics:
  • Overview of Computer Science
  • Overview of Programming and Computer Organization
  • Getting Started with Python
  • Control Statements
  • Data Structures: Lists
  • Data Structures: Dictionaries, Sets, and Tuples
  • Classes and Objects
  • Time & Space Complexity

weeks.description: In week 2, we will use our understanding of programming as a bridge to understand fundamental mathematical concepts and syntax. Symbols and terminology will be introduced to you and you will be able recognize mathematical objects in any branch of mathematics. We will cover functions, sets and relations, logic, proofs and mathematical induction. We will then apply these mathematical concepts directly in programming.
weeks.details:
Assessment:
You will complete assignments about topics covered in Module 2.
Topics:
  • Overview of Pure Mathematics
  • Overview of Discrete Mathematics
  • Logic, Axiom, Lemma, Corollary, and Theorem
  • Accumulation, Sequence and Series
  • Maps and Functions
  • Sets and Relations
  • Mathematical Induction
  • Recursion

weeks.weekTitle: Module 3 -  Discrete Mathematics and Advanced Programming
weeks.description: In week 3, we will develop our mathematical proficiency in Discrete Mathematics by exploring and working with examples of graphs, which are mathematical objects with broad applications in both Computer Science and Data Science. Furthermore, we will learn about Languages, Grammars, and Finite State Machines. From there, we will apply what we have learned to Graph Data Structures and then Regular Expressions.
weeks.details:
Topics:
  • Graph Theory
  • Directed Graphs
  • Finite State Machines
  • Regular Expressions
  • Graph Data Structures
  • Combinatorics
  • Capstone Project

MPD.event: Attend the Course Q&A on 08/May/2022 to learn more about this program.

children.title: Review of Time and Space Complexity
